@dkm2110 I've been trying to add test for `DataMover` and `DataCache`, but it seems we can't reliably do so without faking a wrapper interface on top of `DirectoryInfo` and `FileInfo`, at the least. Given that adding the wrapper interfaces will take up a lot of lines and obfuscate the CR, I'll split this into two tasks - creating the interfaces and then this PR (REEF-1357). I'll close this PR first. Thanks for the review!

@afchung I am wondering what are the relation of these interfaces to the IFileSystem interface we already have. In some sense shouldn't IDirectoryInfo and IFileInfo be part of general IFileSystem interface and we just need to expand it...Or I am over generalizing? Basically, if a user comes to REEF, and looks at these interfaces will he be clear what IFileSystem is intended for and what IFileInfo and other related interfaces intended for. I will do the review once we figure out this question. @markusweimer can you also comment?
.NET tests pass locally, so I'll merge without waiting for AppVeyor approval

@dkm2110 these interfaces are simply to allow us to perform tests by mocking out `DirectoryInfo` and `FileInfo`. These, at the moment, very specifically refer to local directories and files only, and many of these concepts/methods may not apply to remote file systems. We can in time certainly extend them for usage in `IFileSystem`, but supporting such interfaces will not be trivial for remote file systems.
Seems like @anupam128 has already implemented something similar in `LoggingHelper.LogAndIgnoreExceptionIfAny`. Perhaps we should just deprecate `Forget` and use that instead?
@anupam128 I will close this PR, reopen one with a new title and updated descriptions, and update the JIRA item to reflect the switch to `LoggingHelper.LogAndIgnoreExceptionIfAny`. Thanks!
I will test and merge.

For setting the version in the text, I looked at using velocity, as described [here](http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-site-plugin/examples/creating-content.html#Filtering). This allows us to define the latest released version in the POM. If this is the way to go, we need to augment the release guide to update that, and/or update the Python scripts to do that.

`TestEvaluatorWithActiveContextImmediatePoison` has been failing transiently (but infrequently) for some time now. We need to look at it at some point. Feel free to disregard this test for now.

Excellent. I tested locally and it passes. Will merge.

Done with a pass. Overall, LGTM from a code quality perspective. On the design, I have one concern: This enumerates all the cache levels explicitly in `public` APIs. This is fine as long as we don't see ourselves supporting more (or less) caching levels on a particular system. Are we sure of that?

An alternative would be to make a caching tier an interface that can move data into itself from another caching tier. The cache manager than would get a set of these, including a weight which indicates which cache is faster than which other cache. 

Am I making sense?
LGTM, will merge.
I haven't seen the branch for 0.15 yet. Are you sure this is a good idea right now?
